title: mojo.rpc.AttributeContext.Request
description:
This message defines attributes for an HTTP request. If the actual
request is not an HTTP request, the runtime system should try to map
the actual request to an equivalent HTTP request.

headers.description:
The HTTP request headers. If multiple headers share the same key, they
must be merged according to the HTTP spec. All header keys must be
lowercased, because HTTP header keys are case-insensitive.

id.description:
The unique ID for a request, which can be propagated to downstream
systems. The ID should have low probability of collision
within a single day for a specific service.

method.description: The HTTP request method, such as `GET`, `POST`.

protocol.description:
The network protocol used with the request, such as "http/1.1",
"spdy/3", "h2", "h2c", "webrtc", "tcp", "udp", "quic". See
https://www.iana.org/assignments/tls-extensiontype-values/tls-extensiontype-values.xhtml#alpn-protocol-ids
for details.

query.description:
The HTTP URL query in the format of `name1=value1&name2=value2`, as it
appears in the first line of the HTTP request. No decoding is performed.

reason.description:
A special parameter for request reason. It is used by security systems
to associate auditing information with a request.

scheme.description: The HTTP URL scheme, such as `http` and `https`.

size.description: The HTTP request size in bytes. If unknown, it must be -1.

time.description:
The timestamp when the `destination` service receives the last byte of
the request.
